title: Vanessa Riley hybrid logo - sans and slight serifs
content:
Can anyone ID this font - or is custom like so many other perfume and fashion designers’ logos?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070809001531im_/http:/typophile.com/files/index_logo.png)

 [‹ (x) Skin Party navigation type - FF Meta {Dav}](http://web.archive.org/web/20070809001531/http:/typophile.com/node/19164 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) IKEA serif face - New Century Schoolbook (custom version) {Geoff} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070809001531/http:/typophile.com/node/19149 "Go to next forum topic")
author: evan

comments.content:
I’m guessing custom (couldn’t find it among the semiserif at myfonts) but Invoice is very similar

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/madtype/invoice/](http://web.archive.org/web/20070809001531/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/madtype/invoice/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/madtype/invoice/")

Ah, the classic mutiliate-a-classic-font philosophy of custom type design.

hhp

The prime candidate is usually Trajan.  
Got a better/bigger image?

hhp

nope, from webpage, ugh

[www.vanessariley.com/homepage](http://web.archive.org/web/20070809001531/http:/www.vanessariley.com/homepage "www.vanessariley.com/homepage")

Optima looks to require less tweaking than trajan would

You might go the route of a face that is already hybridized like [ITC Binary](http://web.archive.org/web/20070809001531/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=2&displayfontid=C.100098.0.0&fontRendererText=VANESSA+RILEY) or [Golota](http://web.archive.org/web/20070809001531/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=9&displayfontid=C.105003.0.0&fontRendererText=VANESSA+RILEY).

\> ITC Binary

Like I was saying, mutiliate-a-classic-font (Rotis)...

\> Golota

Huh, what a nice “S” he “ended up” with!... :-/

hhp

Berndal’s Golota is very similar to Optima, yes, but not as refined of course:

[Golota ’S’](http://web.archive.org/web/20070809001531/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=C.105003.1.3&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=S&sampleSize=388)  
 [Optima ’S’](http://web.archive.org/web/20070809001531/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=LH.120968.0.3&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=S&sampleSize=388)

Rotis already has a semiserif.

Cicero isn’t bad either

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/presencetypo/cicero/](http://web.archive.org/web/20070809001531/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/presencetypo/cicero/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/presencetypo/cicero/")

other examples at myfonts

[http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=semiserif](http://web.archive.org/web/20070809001531/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=semiserif "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=semiserif")

Check out New Age as well
Wasn’t there a typeface at one time named Oneiota or Iota that looked like this?

\> Rotis already has a semiserif.

Yeah, but not one that’s been through the  
Heavy cycle of a washing machine I guess.

hhp
